item.latestTitle: Finding that the President has not complied with section 2 of the Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act of 2015.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 245 - 186 (Roll no. 492). (text: CR H5891-5892)

item.latestTitle: To suspend until January 21, 2017, the authority of the President to waive, suspend, reduce, provide relief from, or otherwise limit the application of sanctions pursuant to an agreement related to the nuclear program of Iran.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.latestTitle: To approve the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, signed at Vienna on July 14, 2015, relating to the nuclear program of Iran.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 186 (Roll no. 491). (text: CR H5882)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 186 (Roll no. 491).(text: CR H5882)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H5890)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 412.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5882-5891)
Resolution provides for consideration of 3 measures: H. Res. 411; H.R.3460; and H.R. 3461.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 57.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-259, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-259, by Mr. Sessions.

Sets forth the rule for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 411) finding that the President has not complied with section 2 of the Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act of 2015; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3461) to approve the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, signed at Vienna on July 14, 2015, relating to the nuclear program of Iran; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3460) to suspend until January 21, 2017, the authority of the President to waive, suspend, reduce, provide relief from, or otherwise limit the application of sanctions pursuant to an agreement related to the nuclear program of Iran.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
